title: McDonald's mother uses Happy Meal box to fill it with homemade chicken nuggets and Kinder Surprise
text:
A mother has come up with a clever solution to save money after she was fed up with her children always demanding McDonald's Happy Meals.

The Australian woman decided to reuse the fast food cardboard box so she could include her homemade chicken nuggets, apple slices and a Kinder Surprise.

Instead of paying $7.85, she only spent $2.20 at the supermarket for the chocolate, which comes with a toy, and she filled the box up using ingredients already found in her kitchen.

The Australian woman decided to reuse the fast food cardboard box so she could include her homemade chicken nuggets, apple slices and a Kinder Surprise

Instead of paying $7.85, she only spent $2.20 on the chocolate, which comes with a toy, and she filled the box up using ingredients already found in her kitchen

Taking to a Facebook group, she shared a picture of her creation.

'For all you mums out there who have kids that request Happy Meals ALL. THE. TIME.... Keep the box and customise your own,' she said.

'They'll never know and you save money.'

After surprising her children with the box, the mother was met with delight.

'Fake Happy Meals still equals a happy child,' she added.

A six Chicken McNuggets Happy Meal costs $7.85, while a Cheeseburger Happy Meal is retailed at $5.50.
description: An Australian mother has come up with a clever solution to save money after she was fed up with her children always wanting McDonald's Happy Meals.
authors: Cindy Tran For Daily Mail Australia
